Malice::
 
Malice checked Wolfblade's reading with his own sensor array, confirming the signal.  He was about to make another wise crack when she leaned up and kissed him a second time.  He paused mid stride to kiss her back, and had to break the tender moment as his sensors picked up movement close by.  He looked in the direction the signal came from, trying to pin down signal's sourse.
 
"Something or someone is out there, watching us," he said softly, not wanting to let this observer get away unpunished should the need arise.

Dark Mouse <raccoon7679@...> wrote:
Silence::

She had stayed on her perch and waited patiently for an answer to her
pod.  She swept down and landed on the ground. Transforming into bot
mode, she checked her scanners.  Two clicks north were two bots on her
screen.  She double checked the readings, they appeared to be
Maximals.  She changed back into owl mode and took to the skies.  It
took her no time at all to track the signal.  After a few minutes, she
could see two figures on the edge of the woods.  Yes, the signals were
Maximal.  But why did they look like they had thier face plates fused
together. She wondered what kind of bot world she had found herself
in.  She turned her wings and flew back to her tree.  She remained
perched and waited. She wasn't going to leave things to chance. If
these two bots made it to her pod, then she knew things might be
alright. But for now, the beacon was still going and it could attract
friend and foe alike.  She would not give her position untill she knew
it was safe. 


"HA!  Is that all you got?  You boasted such power, such skill!  Where is your power and skill now?  You disappoint me, ha ha ha haa!" 

		
---------------------------------
Celebrate Yahoo!'s 10th Birthday! 
 Yahoo! Netrospective: 100 Moments of the Web
